alert.note: Alert for Val Verde (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 23 at 7:58PM CDT until August 24 at 11:55AM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas... Rio Grande At Foster Ranch affecting Val Verde County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Rio Grande at Foster Ranch. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, (5.5 meters), the flow is well into the flood plain and threatens campers, gear and autos below Dryden to Amistad Reservoir. The flow is very turbulent with eddies and whirlpools dangerous to swimmers, canoeists and kayakers from above Foster Ranch to Amistad Reservoir. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 18.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 14.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:15 PM CDT Wednesday was 23.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this evening and continue falling to 1.8 feet Monday evening. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 18.9 feet on 05/31/1986. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Rio Grande Foster Ranc 14.0 18.0 Wed 7 pm CDT 4.9 2.0 1.7 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday morning at 800 AM CDT.
